conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m applying to School_E as my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would enthusiastically accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. Although School_E ranks me 4th, other students who may apply there (A, D, E) each have School_D as their first choice, so they are likely to target School_D in round 1. That gives me a good chance to secure my first choice early by applying now with a clear commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for ranking School_E as your first choice. After reviewing your submission in the context of our current admissions priorities and limited capacity this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is applying now, but on School_E’s true priority list they rank 4th (A, D, E, then B). Since quota is 1 and it is only round 1, it is strategically better to keep the seat open to try to attract higher-priority students (Student_A/Student_D/Student_E). Student_B’s preference ranks School_E first, so they are likely to accept immediately, but accepting now risks blocking a better match. Therefore reject in round 1 to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D. School_D is my first choice, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

Accepting Student_D now secures my #2 choice and avoids the risk that Student_D matches elsewhere in later rounds. Waiting for Student_B is risky because Student_B’s first choice is School_E, so they may never apply to School_D. Therefore, accept Student_D.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. With quota 1 and only Student_A applying to us this round, accepting now could block a higher-priority student (E/C/D) who may come to us later if rejected elsewhere. Student_E ranks School_A last, Student_C ranks School_A 4th, Student_D ranks School_A 4th—so it’s plausible one of C or D could later apply if they fail at their higher choices (notably School_D). Given we can only respond accept/reject to an [APPLY] and cannot hold/waitlist, the optimal move to maximize chance of matching with a higher-priority student is to reject Student_A now and keep the seat available.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

Thank you again for reviewing my earlier application. I noticed School_C is still available, and I wanted to reiterate that School_C remains one of my top choices. If there is any possibility of reconsideration (e.g., a waitlist or a remaining seat to be filled), I would be grateful to be considered. Is there any additional information you would like from me to support my candidacy?

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_C remain unmatched. School_C is higher on my true preference list than School_A, but I already applied to School_C and was rejected based on priorities, so a second immediate APPLY is unlikely to change the outcome. Since School_C is still unmatched, I will send a TALK message to reopen dialogue, express continued strong interest, and ask whether any reconsideration/waitlist is possible given remaining capacity. If they indicate openness, I can APPLY next round; otherwise I will pivot to School_A.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for following up and for your continued interest in School_C. At this time, we’re not able to reconsider your application for an offer of admission, and there isn’t additional material that would change our decision in this round.

If anything changes with seat availability later in the process, we will review options at that time, but for now we encourage you to continue pursuing your other preferred schools.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_C is last on School_C’s true priority list and was already rejected. We have quota 1 and a higher-priority applicant (Student_A) in the inbox this round, plus even higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_E) exist in the market. Therefore, we should not encourage Student_C to apply again; keep the option open via TALK but signal we cannot reconsider at this time, preserving the seat for higher-priority candidates.
